title: Luss Village Walk Route

images.title: David Roberts / Luss Pier
images.caption: The pier, a calling point for cruises on Loch Lomond. The village and mountains look nice in the autumn sunshine.

images.title: Phil Champion / Footbridge over Luss Water
images.caption: Footbridge over Luss Water. Luss Glebe is a twenty-three acre site accessible by land only across this footbridge, constructed for the parish church by the Royal Engineers in May 2006. A previous bridge was washed away in January 1993.

images.title: Dave Croker / Visitor centre at Luss
images.caption: Visitor centre.

description: Enjoy an easy circular walk around this delightful conservation village on the western shore of Loch Lomond. If you're visiting the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park then Luss is one of the must see areas. You can catch boat trips from the pier, stroll along the pretty beach and then explore the delightful village with its pretty sandstone and slate cottages. This walk starts at the pier and follows the Luss Heritage Trail through the village to a small woodland area where you pick up a lovely riverside path. This leads you past pretty weirs to the loch, where you will pass the 19th century parish church before returning to the pier. It's a pleasant, varied walk with great views of the loch and woodland, river and lochside sections. If you'd like to extend your walk then you could climb the nearby Beinn Dubh for wonderful views over Glen Luss and Loch Lomond.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Also of interest is the enachanting Luss Fairy Walk. This lovely woodland trail is a popular family attraction in the village. You can find out more information and buy tickets at the car park at postcode G83 8NY. To the south is the worthy town of Helensburgh where you can enjoy splendid coastal walks along the Firth of Clyde and pick up the Three Lochs Way long distance trail. Balloch Castle Country Park can be found at the southern end of the loch. You can follow the West Lomond Cycle Path to the lovely park as it passes through Luss on its way along the western side of the loch. For more walking ideas in the area see the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs Walks page.

display_address: Thistle Cottage, Pier Road, Luss, Argyll and Bute, Alba / Scotland, G83 8NN, United Kingdom
